text: You tail a group of raiders as they approach a settlement, and you suspect that they don't mean to go shopping

options.optionText: Attack their leader
options.result: You ambush the raider leader.
options.aftermath: Draw and fight [Human]; if you defeat it, gain the 'Big Frigger' unique asset

options.optionText: A little opportunistic thieving never hurt anyone... much
options.result: As the raiders begin their attack on the town you slip into the marketplace and help yourself to the goods. You notice a sad pair of eyes watching you from a nearby doorway and feel a pang of guilt. You monster.

text: News of a heroic battle has spread to nearby settlements. The eager wastelanders want nothing more than to hear tales of battle from the mouth of a hero.

options.optionText: FORCED if you are Idolized • [C] 4

result.result: Succeed: You tell your story, embellishing in all the right places. The crowd is enamored, showering you with gifts.
Fail: You can feel you audience's attention waning, so youend the tale and go on with your day.

options.optionText: Go aout your business
options.result: The settlement is alive with the bustle of daily life.

text:
If at a level-2 or lower [Wasteland], encounter the next card. Then, add this card.

Another tremor shakes the earth. This time, it is accompanied by a twisted limb bursting up from beneath the soil. It must have come from an underground tunnel, whatever it is.

options.optionText: Stand fast • Draw and fight [Monster]

result.result: Succeed: The best falls, and you slump to your knees, relieved.
Fail:Sensing the beast has the upper hand, you run for your life.

options.optionText: Flee!
options.result: You head toward safety as quickly as you can.

options.optionText: You are at a level-2 or lower [Wasteland]

text: A man wrapped in bandages is arguing with a doctor about the cost of his treatment.

options.optionText: FORCED if you are Idolized
options.result: The man smiles warmly at you as you approach. 'Greetings, friend! I've seen better days, to be sure, but today I'm glad to be alive. Here, have a drink with me.'

options.optionText: Offer to pay the fee • Spend 5 Caps
options.result: 'I can't possibly thank you enough,' the man says. 'Take this. It's a rare, pre-war formula. I think you'll like it.'

options.optionText: Ignore them and go shopping

text: A neon sign that says 'Grand Opening' hangs above an apparel shop in the marketplace.

options.optionText: See what they have for sale
options.result: The proprietors greet you warmly.
options.aftermath: Reveal items from the asset deck until you reveal an Apparel asset, add it to the shop, and discard the rest; then shop once

options.optionText: Steal from their stuff when they aren't looking • [P] [A] 4

result.result: Succeed: You handily steal something from a pile labeled 'To be repaired.'
result.aftermath: Choose 1 Apparel item from the discard pile • 2 XP

result.result: Fail: The owners catch your brazen attempt to steal from them and ban you from their shop.

text: A neon sign that says 'Grand Opening' hangs above a weapon shop in the marketplace

options.optionText: See what they have for sale
options.result: The proprietors greet you warmly.
options.aftermath: Reveal items from the asset deck until you reveal a Weapon asset, add it to the shop, and discard the rest; then shop once

options.optionText: Steal from their stuff when they aren't looking • [P] [A] 4

result.result: Succeed: You handily steal something from a pile labeled 'To be repaired.'
result.aftermath: Choose 1 Weapon item from the discard pile • 2 XP

result.result: Fail: The owners catch your brazen attempt to steal from them and ban you from their shop.

title: Welcome To The Wasteland
text: The Brotherhood of Steel paladins own the wasteland here, but a secret power grows in the background, claiming charity and generosity amidst rumors of mutants and experiments gone mad.

options.optionText:
Learn about the mysterious Unity

[Quest] any [Settlement] • [C] 3

Find information on the Brotherhood

[Quest] The Hub

title: Think Of The Children
text: The Unity welcomes all with open arms. Sure, they're a little weird, but they have you recruiting for them in no time. As it turns out, for a hot meal and a few Caps, even the meanest wasteland raider will join up. Still, the rumors of strange experiments persist.

options.optionText:
Recurit for the Unity

[Quest] Replace a [Human] in your space or an adjacent space with [Shield]

When a [Shield] is placed on the map and there are now at least [Shield] on the map equal to the number of survivors

Kill one of the experiments

Kill any [Super Mutant]

text: Radiation is overwhelming here. No wonder the Brotherhood hasn't come to reclaim their lost records. Still, you have a job to do, and you intend to see it through.

options.optionText: Risk the radiation • [P] [E] [A] 4

result.result: Succeed: You find the safest path you can through the radiation and grab the holodisk.
result.aftermath: Suffer 1 [Radiation] • Keep this card; it is the Holodisk

result.result: Fail: The radiation sickens you, causing you to vomit, but you emerge with the holodisk, alive.
result.aftermath: Suffer 4 [Radiation] • Keep this card; it is the Holodisk

options.optionText: Leave. It is too dangerous
options.result: There is too much radiation here. You'll come back later.

title: We Happy Few
text:
You meet a Brotherhood paladin and express some interest in their organization. He scoffs at you. 'Sure,' he says. 'Head out into the wastelands and bring back one of our lost holodisks. Then you can join.' He waks away laughing. It is clear that he doesn't think you can do it.

Have [Wilderness] encounters to find the Holodisk.

options.optionText:
Screw this guy! Down with the Broterhood!

Kill any [Star]

Bring back the holodisk

[Quest] Lost Hills Bunker • Holodisk

title: The Wheel Goes 'Round
text:
The Unity appears to be making a strike against the citizens of the Hub while the Brotherhood is occupied with internal affairs. Those who have refused to join them, it seems, must be purged.

[Shield] move toward The Hub instead of survivors.

options.optionText:
Help coordinate the Unity's movement.

[Quest] Replace a [Human] in your space or an adjacent space with [Shield]

Any [Shield] is at The Hub

Attack the Unity and protect the people.

Kill the last [Shield] on the map

text:
If 'Mariposa Military Base' is no longer staged, trash this card and encounter the next card.

If not at Mariposa Military Compound, encounter the next card. Then, add this card.

You descend into the ruins of Mariposa Military Base, finding vats of roiling green liquid deep withing. There is no doubt in your mind that this is the FEV.

options.optionText: Destroy the vats of FEV • [S] [I] 4

result.result: Succeed: You destroy the noxious vats. The Brotherhood will be pleased.
Fail: You fail to find a good way to dispose of it.

options.optionText:
Collect some of the FEV
Have loyalty with [Shield]
options.result: You take several samples of the virus. Whatever happens to the vats, you take solace in knowing that your samples will be safe.
options.aftermath: Keep this card; it is the FEV.

options.optionText: 'Mariposa Military Base' is no longer staged.
Not at 'Mariposa Military Base.'

title: Mariposa Military Base
text:
Shocked at your display of bravery, the Brotherhood welcome you as one of their own. Recent events have shown that the strange mutants are being created at a nearby base using a virus known as 'FEV'.

Place a quest marker 3 spaces away from your current space. This is Mariposa Military Base; it counts as a level-3 [Wilderness] in addition to other icons in that space.

options.optionText:
Prepare the Unity to fight the Brotherhood.

[Quest] Any [Settlement] • Place [Shield] in your space if there isn't already a [Shield] present

When a [Shield] is placed on the map and there are [Shield] on the map equal to or greater than the number of survivors

Head to the base and destroy the FEV.

Have encounters at Mariposa Military Base until you destroy the FEV

text:
A group of Children of the Cathedral have breached the upper level of Lost Hills and are making their way into the lower levels.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 succesful defences, complete the 'Attack on Lost Hills' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Intercept them • Draw and fight [Human]

result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: You skirmish with the enemy to no avail.

options.optionText: Reprogram a nearby cleaning bot to do the dirty work for you • [I] 4

result.result: Succeed: You reprogram the cleaning bot to view the invaders as literal dirt.
result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: The bot catches fire, seriously burning you.

text:
Super Mutants are attacking Lost Hills Bunker. You come across a group of Brotherhood paladins engaged with the brutish creatures.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 successful defenses, complete the 'Attack on Lost Hills' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Assist the paladins • Draw and fight [Super Mutant]

result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: A super mutant bats a paladin aside like a ragdoll, killing him instantly

options.optionText: Provide the paladins with medical supplies • Discard 1 Aid item
options.result: The paladins are grateful for what you have brought for them, and they distribute the supplies to their most wounded soldiers.
options.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

text:
You pick out a man in a deep purple robe who looks to be coordinating the attacks on Lost Hills.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 successful defenses, comple the 'Attack on Lost Hills' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Engage him head-on • Draw and fight [Human]; apply +1 to its level

result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

options.optionText: Sneak around behind him and take him by surprise • [A] 4

result.result: Succeed: You take care of the problem quickly and quietly. The attacking force is in disarray.
result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: Your loud fumbling gives you away, and he sends his minions after you.

title: Attack On Lost Hills
text:
The conflict between the Brotherhood and the Unity is coming to a head. The Children of the Cathedral and the super mutants that form the Unity have joined forces and are moving on the Brotherhood base at Lost Hills.

Place 1 [Star] in each space of the tile that contains Lost Hills Bunker that does not have a [Star].

options.optionText:
Kill the Brotherhood paladins.

[Quest] Lost Hills Bunker • No [Star] on map
options.aftermath:
[Shield] + • 2 XP
Trash each card in the [Star] deck

options.optionText:
Defend Lost Hills Bunker

Have encounters at Lost Hills Bunker to repel the attack

text:
The uncompromising Brotherhood of Steel has brought its might to bear against the Unity. They have several men stationed in front of the Cathedral.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 successful defenses, complete the 'Attack on the Cathedral' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Wipe them out • Draw and fight [Human]; it gains the [Armor] icon

result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: You fail to pierce the paladins' power armor.

options.optionText: Toss grenades • Discard a [Grenade] item
options.result: You make quick work of the Brotherhood paladins as they reel from the explosive blasts.
options.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

text:
The brotherhood has established a forward outpost near the Cathedral.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 successful defenses, comple the 'Attack on the Cathedral' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Pose as a member of the Brotherhood and infiltrate their ranks • [C] [L] 4

result.result: Succeed: You learn their movements, and pass the information along to the Unity
result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

result.result: Fail: You stand out like a sore thumb, and the Brotherhood attacks you.

options.optionText: Fund the Unity • Spend 8 Caps
options.result: The now well equipped Unity moves on the forward outpost.
options.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a successful defense

text:
Brotherhood of Steel paladins are about to overrun the lower levels of the Cathedral.

If, after resolving this encounter, survivors have enacted 3 successful defenses, complete the 'Attack on the Cathedral' quest, and each survivor with 1 or more successful defenses may discard them to gain 2 XP per card.

options.optionText: Make a stand • Draw and fight [Human]

result.result: Succeed: You cut one paladin down, but another takes his place.
result.aftermath: Draw and fight [Human] • Keep this card; is is a successfull defense

result.result: Fail: You are forced to withdraw from the battle.

options.optionText: Sacrafice yourself for the Unity
options.result: You detonate an explosion that fills the halls with fire.
options.aftermath: You are killed • Keep this card; it is a successful defense

title: Attack On The Cathedral
text:
The conflict between the Brotherhood and the Unity is coming to a head. The brotherhood of Steel is moving on the Unity, located in the depths of The Cathedral.

Place 1 [Shiedl] on each space of the tile that contains the Cathedral that does not have a [Shield]

options.optionText: Defend the Cathedral.

Kill members of the Unity.

[Quest] The Cathedral • No [Shield] on map

text: The grotesque form of the Master looms before you. 'Become one with the Unity or die!'

options.optionText: Accept the Master's gift
options.aftermath: Keep this card; it is the FEV

options.optionText: Reject the gift

Convince the Master to disband the Unity
[P] [C] 6; add 1 [Hit] if you have the Holodisk

result.result: Succeed: You convince the Master that what he has done will do nothing to preserve civilization. Shockingly, he seems to hear you, and he urges you to leave him to die alone.
Fail: The Master orders his minions to attack.

text: You find a nuke in the lower levels of the Cathedral.

options.optionText: Set off the nuke • [P] [I] 5

result.result: Succeed: In the moments before the bomb detonates, you feel at peace. Then, nothing.
result.aftermath:
Complete 'Rise of the Master'
Each survivor and enemy within 3 spaces is killed

result.result: Fail: You fiddle with the bomb to no effect.

options.optionText: Dismantle the nuke • [P] [I] 5

result.result: Succeed: This bomb poses a monumental threat to the Unity, and you dismantle it quickly, potentially saving the entire cause.
Fail: You fiddle with the bomb to no effect.

title: Rise Of The Master
text: The grand finale is at hand, and the master behind the Unity has revealed himself.

options.optionText:
Join the Unity. Become one with the Unity.

[Quest] The Cathedral • [E] [C] 6; add 1 [Hit] of each vial of FEV you have
options.aftermath:
[Shield] + +
Become a Super Mutant • 4 XP
Trash each card in the [Shield] deck

options.optionText:
Destroy the Master, once and for all.

Either

[Quest] The Cathedral • Draw and fight [Super Mutant]; apply +1 to its level

or

Have encounters at The Cathedral to find another way to defeat the Master
options.aftermath:
[Star] + + • 4 XP
Trash each card in the [Shield] deck

title: Welcome to New California
text: Arroyo, a small village in New California, is suffering. Drought has brought the villagers to the edge of desperation, and in their hour of need they have turned to anyone who will listen.

options.optionText:
Visit Arroyo and hear them out.

[Quest] Arroyo • [C] 3
Explore the Arroyo hunting grounds.
options.result: [Quest] Arroyo • Draw and fight [Critter]

title: The Future Of All Mankind
text: The village elder of Arroyo is looking to acquire an object known as a G.E.C.K. - a Garden of Eden Creation Kit - in order to combat the drought.

options.optionText:
Search for information about the G.E.C.K. in the New California Republic.

[Quest] New California Republic • [P] [C] 4

Buy a round of drinks at the Rawhide Salloon.

[Quest] New California Republic • Spend 3 Caps
options.aftermath: Gain 1 Companion from the shop, ignoring its requirement

title: Lock And Key
text: Rumor has it that most Vault-Tec vaults were outfitted with a G.E.C.K. or two. If you can find a vault, you might be able to procure a G.E.C.K.

options.optionText:
Explore the wasteland and find a way to enter a vault and retrieve a G.E.C.K.

Do any one of the following:

1) Complete 'The Leviathan'
2) Complete 'The Desert Vault'
3)Resolve encounter 080 or 081
4) Resolve any [Vault 109] encounter
5) [Quest] Discard a 'G.E.C.K.' item
options.aftermath:
[Star] +
Place 1 [Shield] on Arroyo
Move each [Shield] to the closest space to Arroyo that has no [Shield]
Draw and resolve [Diamond] 240
2 Group XP

options.optionText:
Or I could go bet on the mole rat races happening outside of town!

[Quest] any [Wasteland] • Spend 2 Caps • Test [L]

title: Scorched Earth
text: While the search for the G.E.C.K. was in progress, an organization known as the Enclave has taken over Arroyo, intending to use its citizens as test subjects for a biological weapon that would kill any living being with mutated genetics - including humans.

options.optionText:
Wipe the Enclave out of Arroyo.

When there are no [Shield] within 3 tiles of Arroyo
options.aftermath:
[Star] +
Place 3 [Shield] on Poseidon Oil Rig
1 Group XP

options.optionText:
With all the commotion drawing watchful eyes everywhere, you think robbing the local cemeteries could be a profitable venture.

[Quest] Any [Settlement] • Spend 1 additional action
Test [S] [P] 4
options.aftermath: Reveal five [Item] cards, choose 1 and discard the rest • Become Vilified

title: The Poseidon Oil Rig
text: Through the Enclave have been routed from Arroyo, many of Arroyo's residents were kidnapped and taken to the Enclave's headquarters, located on the Poseidon Oil Rig. What's worse, they've got a guy guarding them who would give the strongest Super Mutant a run for its money.

options.optionText:
Board the Oil Rig and take out the man guarding the prisoners.

[Quest] Poseidon Oil Rig • Draw and fight [Human]; apply +2 to its level

Some people representing an establishment called the Chop Shop are looking for car parts from the wasteland.

[Quest] Any [Wasteland] • Discard 1 'Junk' item

title: The Vault Of The Future
text: Whispers of a still-sealed vault hidden beneath the surface of a lake reach your ears. Most of the known vaults have either been looted or transformed into thriving settlements, so you jump at the chance to learn more about it.

options.optionText:
Sweet talk those in the know for info.

[Quest] any [Settlement] • Test [C] • Spend 5 Caps; spend 1 fewer Cap for each [Hit]

Wait near Vault 7 for someone who looks like they know what they are doing.

[Quest] Vault 7 &bull [L] 4

text: You find a heap of metal and glass scrap. You think you could use it to fashion a number of devices.

options.optionText: Build a Rebreather • [I] 3

result.result: Succeed: You manage to cobble together a device that will allow you to breathe underwater.
result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a Rebreather

result.result: Fail: You have absolutely no idea what you are doing, and you cut yourself on some sharp glass. Ouch!

options.optionText: Build something useful... or expolosive!
options.result: You assemble something from the scraps of metal and glass. It is not what you set out to build, but you think it may be useful nonetheless.
options.aftermath: Choose 1 Tool, Trap, or Grenade item from the shop or the discard pile.

title: Deep Breaths
text:
You learn that in order to get into Vault 7, you'll need to build some sort of breathing apparatus or be able to hold your breath underwater. Additionally, you are warned that for whatever reason, none who have set out to explore the vault have returned to tell of it.

Encounter any [Wasteland] until you find the parts you need to build a Rebreather

options.optionText:
Build a rebreather

[Quest] Vault 7 • Rebreather

Who needs a rebreather? Hold your breath and make the dive.

[Quest] Vault 7 • Have [E]

title: The Leviathan
text:
The Vault doors slide open as your approach. Uh oh. With a loud rumble the lake water goes rushing into the vault, taking you with it. You fight against the current, but are unable to resist. As you are sucked through the massive steel door, it slides shut again, and you find that you are trapped in pitch black darkness, underwater.

While this quest is staged, survivors on the Vault 7 space cannot perform the move action and must perform the encounter action on each of their turns, if able. Additionally, while this quest is staged, enemies ignore survivors on the Vault 7 space.

options.optionText:
You gotta get out of here.

Encounter [Vault 7] until you find a way to escape
options.aftermath: Trash this card and each card in the [Vault 7] deck

text:
You feel frigid current tugging at you as you swim into the lightless depths. Could it be a way out? Or is it just pulling you deeper into the Vault?

If you are not Mister Handy and do not have a Rebreather, suffer 2 damage.

options.optionText: Go with the flow • [A] [L] 4

result.result: Succeed: The current picks up and you are sucked suddenly through a vent into a room that is somehow not filled with water. Atop a pedestal in the center of the room is a strange device, the likes of which you have never seen.
Fail: You are deposited into a room with some kind of horrible creature. Oh well, everyone has to die sometime.

options.optionText: Swim against the current
options.result: As you swim through the tunnels, scavenging for anything that might help you escape, the water turns hazy and you begin to feel ill.

text:
You feel frigid current tugging at you as you swim into the lightless depths. Could it be a way out? Or is it just pulling you deeper into the Vault?

If you are not Mister Handy and do not have a Rebreather, suffer 2 damage.

options.optionText: Go with the flow • [A] [L] 4

result.result: Succeed: You emerge in the lakebed outside the vault. You're glad to be alive, but you wonder what secrets are yet to be uncovered.
result.aftermath:
[Agenda Card]
Place your character in a space adjacent to Vault 7

result.result: Fail: You are deposited into a room with some kind of skittering creature. What is this place, some kind of menagerie?

options.optionText: Swim against the current
options.result: You find the skeleton of a long-dead explorer -- complete with breathing apparatus -- near the vault door. He must have been looking for a way out.
options.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a Rebreather

text:
You feel frigid current tugging at you as you swim into the lightless depths. Could it be a way out? Or is it just pulling you deeper into the Vault?

If you are not Mister Handy and do not have a Rebreather, suffer 2 damage.

options.optionText: Go with the flow • [A] [L] 4

result.result: Succeed: You close your eyes and drift with the current, letting it draw you through the dark tunnels of the vault. When you open your eyes, you are in a well-lit chamber, surrounded by bottles of Nuka-Cola, Caps intact. Neat!
Fail: You are deposited into a room with some kind of mutated creatuere. What is this place, some kind of menagerie?

options.optionText: Swim against the current
options.result: As you flounder in the water, you see movement. Looks like someone else go sucked in by the vault.

text:
You find a working computer encapsulated in a bubble of air. You are able to interface with it by putting your arms through two long tubes. Spotlights illuminate the console, as if beckoning to you.

If you are not a Mister Handy and do not have a Rebreather, suffer 2 damage.

options.optionText: Search for information about the vault's residents
options.result: The computer reports that the vault has no living residents -- nor has it ever been assigned any. The vault appears to be recording information on those who find their way inside. You find an entry for yourself, even.

options.optionText: Search for a map of the vault • [P] [I] 4

result.result: Succeed: 'ACCESS DENIED: Maps violate Leviathan Protocol, Releasing Guardian.'
Fail: The computer issues a drawn-out, ear-shattering beep, then discharges an electric charge into the water.

text:
You find a working computer encapsulated in a bubble of air. You are able to interface with it by putting your arms through two long tubes. Spotlights illuminate the console, as if beckoning to you.

If you are not a Mister Handy and do not have a Rebreather, suffer 2 damage.

options.optionText: Search for information about the vault's residents
options.result: You learn that the vault has no overseer and is instead run by an entity known as the 'Guardian,' whatever that means.

options.optionText: Search for a map of the vault • [P] [I] 4

result.result: Succeed: 'ACCESS DENIED: Maps violate Leviathan Protocol. Difficulty increased. Lower levels unlocked.'
Fail: The computer issues a drawn-out, ear shattering beep, then discharges a burst of sound that shatters all nearby glass.
result.aftermath: If you have a Rebreather, discard it

text:
You find a working computer encapsulated in a bubble of air. You are able to interface with it by putting your arms through two long tubes. Spotlights illuminate the console, as if beckoning to you.

If you are not a Mister Handy and do not have a Rebreather, suffer 2 damage.

options.optionText: Search for information about the vault's residents
options.result: Records indicate that the vault has 154,440 different configurations and that the High Score is currently 42. You wonder what that means...

options.optionText: Search for a map of the vault • [P] [I] 4

result.result: Succeed: 'ACCESS DENIED: Insufficent data. Damaged sectors detected. Four. Four four. Fourfourfourfour.' A nearby locker clicks open, and the computer explodes.
result.aftermath: Keep this card; it is a Rebreather

result.result: Fail: You feel a sudden sting on your hand. You've been infected with something, and you start to feel... different.

text:
The Guardian has you in its sights, a blinking red searchlight illuminating you in the dark water. 'ALERT, ALERT: CONTRABAND DETECTED.'
br>If you are not a Mister Handy and do not have a Rebreather, suffer 2 damage.

Draw and fight [Robot]; this is the Guardian

options.optionText: FORCED If you killed the Guardian
options.result: The Guardian buzzes and explodes, sending red-hot shards of its plating sizzling through the water. Amidst the wreckage you find a plethora of sonfiscated 'contraband.'
options.aftermath: Gain the 'You're SPECIAL' unique asset • 4 Caps

options.optionText: FORCED If you did not kill the Guardian
options.result: You swim away as fast as you can, the Guardian following close behind you. 'ERROR: Please return to the staging area to be sorted.'

text: As you descend deeper into the vault, you emerge suddenly into a room with breathable air. Before you, a swirling vortex of water leads back inot the main tunnels. Beyond the vortex, just out of reach is a pedestal, illuminated by a spotlight, some sort of device shining from atop it.

options.optionText: Freeze the water • Either have the 'Cryolator' or discard a 'Cryo Grenade'
options.result: The vortex freezes just long enough for you to run across. You grab the device from atop the pedestal. Hope it's water resistant!

options.optionText: Dive back in; you can't reach it from here
options.result: Shrugging, you leap into the vortex. The other side is just too far to jump to, and you certainly won't be able to swim to it.

text: As you swim into the chamber, it drains of water. A recorded voice comes over a loudspeaker and music begins to play. 'Congratulations, vault dweller! You have completed the Leviathan!' A nerby cute attempts to blast confetti into the air, but it falls to the floor in a single, soggy clump. Searchlights illuminate a lever in the center of the room.

options.optionText: Pull the lever
options.result: Blaring sirens echo throughout the vault and spinning red lights illuminate what was once black. The floor rumbles as water begins to drain from the vault. A small metal locker pops up from the floor, containing your prize. Hooray?
options.aftermath:
[Asset Card] • Gain the 'Vault Security Armor' unique asset
Complete 'The Leviathan'

options.optionText: Turn around; you're not ready to leave yet
options.result: The music stops as you turn around and dive back into the water

title: The Desert Vault
text:
A vault has been discovered in a barren area of the wasteland. Preliminary investigations have yielded no information as to whether or not there are any survivors. You are able to learn the location of the vault with relative ease.

Effects will instruct you to place [Vault 44] cards into the play area. [Vault 44] encounter cards adjacent to eachother are considered to be connected spaces, and survivors can move between them. Resolve a Vault 44 encounter that is in play by performing a [Quest] action while on that card.

options.optionText: Enter the desert vault.
options.result: [Quest] Vault 44

options.optionText: Discover what happened to the vault's inhabitants.
options.result: Encounter [Vault 44] until you learn the secrets of the desert vault
options.aftermath: [Agenda Card] • Trash all [Vault 44] encounters in play and in the [Vault 44] deck

text:
You drop down into the vault, your heavy footsteps echoing along the metal catwalks. You hear skittering in the darkness, but see nothing.

Place this card faceup near the game board and place your figure on it. This card is a space that is adjacent to the Vault 44 space.

Options with an <indicated> direction cannot be selected if there is already a card in the <indicated> direction or if no cards remain in the [Vault 44] deck.

options.optionText: Explore the eastern corridor <right>
options.result: A creature emerges from the shadows.
options.aftermath: Draw and fight [Critter] • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the right of this card

options.optionText: Explore the western corridor <left>
options.result: Some toxic substance coats the corridor heading west.
options.aftermath: Suffer 2 [Radiation] • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the left of this card

text:
It is clear as you walk the halls of Vault 44 that there are no living residents. Water in the vault appears to have been non-functional for some time. A door with a blinking light blocks the exit, though you do notice an air duct that you think you could squeeze into.

Options with an <indicated> direction cannot be selected if there is already a card in the <indicated> direction or if no cards remain in the [Vault 44] deck.

options.optionText: Hack the door • [I] 4 <right>
options.result: You manage to lift the lockdown protocol on the door blocking the eastern exit.
options.aftermath: Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the right of this card

options.optionText: Crawl through the ceiling vent <up>
options.result: As you lift yourself into the vent, you disturb the nest of a disgusting creature and it attacks you in defense.
options.aftermath: Draw and fight [Critter] • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown above this card

text:
You emerge into what is left of a food storage closet. The room is covered in a sheen of sticky fluids, and you can hear the clicking and crawling of creatures in the walls. You can't help but wonder if this infestation is part of what led to the vault's downfall. Several access hallways lead away from the room.

Options with an <indicated> direction cannot be selected if there is already a card in the <indicated> direction or if no cards remain in the [Vault 44] deck.

options.optionText: Pick the door on your left <left>
options.result: As you leave, you stumble over something that must have belonged to one of the vault dwellers.
options.aftermath: Draw 1 [Item] • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the left of this card

options.optionText: Check out the door behind you <down>
options.result: You manage to lift the lockdown protocol on the door blocking the exit.
options.aftermath: [Loot] x 4 • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown below this card

text:
As you begin walking through what were once the living quarters of the vault, your suspicions are confirmed. Those who dwelt here are dead. Malnourished bodies, long deteriorated, lay curled on beds and sprawled against walls in the hallway.

Options with an <indicated> direction cannot be selected if there is already a card in the <indicated> direction or if no cards remain in the [Vault 44] deck.

options.optionText: Pass through the kitchen <left>
options.result: The kitchen is utterly empty, the shelves picked completely clean. If you weren't sure before, you are now; the vault ran out of food.
options.aftermath: 2 XP • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the left of this card

options.optionText: Go through the residential wing <up>
options.result: You find the body of wastelander here as well, much more recently deceased. He must have become trapped here within the last few months.
options.aftermath: 5 Caps • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown above this card.

text:
You find supplies that once would habe belonged to the vault's security team, though they are mostly unusable. Several records indicate that vault security was practically nonexistent in Vault 44. All around the room, the klacking of tiny legs and wings can be heard echoing from within the walls.

Options with an <indicated> direction cannot be selected if there is already a card in the <indicated> direction or if no cards remain in the [Vault 44] deck.

options.optionText: Head north <right>
options.result: As you leave, a wall panel bursts open, and one of the creatures attack you.
options.aftermath: Draw and fight [Critter] • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the right of this card

options.optionText: Head south <down>
options.result: You feel a heaby thump on your head as something falls from the cieling, tangling itself in your clothes and hair as it struggles to get free.
options.aftermath: Draw and fight [Critter] • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown below this card

text:
The hallways open to a much larger room. The Vault Overseer's room. A metal hatch prevents further access to the lower levels.

Options with an <indicated> direction cannot be selected if there is already a card in the <indicated> direction or if no cards remain in the [Vault 44] deck.

options.optionText: Explore to the north <up>
options.result: You keep moving, noting the room for later.
options.aftermath: 1 XP • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown above this card

options.optionText: Unlock the lower levels
options.result: After some fiddling with the Overseer's console, you manage to open the hatch.

options.optionText: Explore to the south <down>
options.result: You keep moving, noting the room for later.
options.aftermath: 1 XP • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown below this card

text:
Beneath the upper levels, the vault is something entirely different. Blue electric currents run up and down circuits as long as hallways. Horrible creatures are chained to the floor and walls by tethers of electricity howling as you pass. A machine is automating a feeding process, shoving food into the creatures' pens.

Options with an <indicated> direction cannot be selected if there is already a card in the <indicated> direction or if no cards remain in the [Vault 44] deck.

options.optionText: Follow the stairs <right>
options.result: Your steps short-circuit the tethers in one of the pens and the creature leaps toward you.
options.aftermath: Draw and fight [Monster] • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the right of this card

options.optionText: See how far the hallways go <left>
options.result: A sentry bot rounds the corner and mistakes you for an escaped creature. Great.
options.aftermath: Draw and fight [Robot] • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the left of this card

text:
This room is filled with converyor belts. A robot here is systematically unloading a box of food and placing it along one of the belts. Several other robots have fallen into disrepair nearby and are unmoving. One even appears to have been riddled with bullets.

Options with an <indicated> direction cannot be selected if there is already a card in the <indicated> direction or if no cards remain in the [Vault 44] deck.

options.optionText: Follow the converyor belts <right>
options.result: You wonder why, with so much food available, the vault dwellers appear to have starved to death. You opt to follow the conveyor belts.
options.aftermath: 3 XP • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the right of this card

options.optionText: Explore deeper into the vault <left>
options.result: The mystery of the vault deepens. You head further into the tunnels, hoping for some indication as to what happened here.
options.aftermath: 3 XP • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the left of this card

text: A huge computer occupies most of the room, and it appears to be operational. Several screens indicate that his room was used to monitor the vault, but you get the feeling that the residents themselves were unaware. The electrical currents all converge here and appear to be powering -- or powered by -- some sort of experimental suit of armor.

options.optionText: Rest a moment
options.result: You rest, not ready to learn the vault's secrets.

options.optionText: Access the vault's logs
options.result: You access copies of the Vault Overseer's logs from this terminal: 'Something is drawing too much power. The refrigeration unit is failing. At this rate, we will starve by the end of the year. I have tried to open the vault door to no avail. Additionally, I keep hearing strange noises from the hatch beneath my office, but I can't open it.'
options.aftermath:
Gain the 'Tesla Armor' unique asset
Place each survivor on a [Vault 44] card in a space adjacent to Vault 44
Complete 'The Desert Vault'

text:
In this room, the desiccated corpse of a scientist lies hunched beside a glowing computer monitor. Left on the screen is the scientist's final report. 'No uncontaminated food left, we locked up the infected in the lower levels and are waiting for response from Vault-Tec. Whatever the result may be, I shall carry to my grave the consciousness that at least we meant well.'

Options with an <indicated> direction cannot be selected if there is already a card in the <indicated> direction or if no cards remain in the [Vault 44] deck.

options.optionText: Take the east exit <right>
options.result: Well, that's depressing.
options.aftermath: 3 XP • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the right of this card

options.optionText: Take the west exit <left>
options.result: You take your leave and attempt to put the fate of these men and women out of your mind.
options.aftermath: 3 XP • Place 1 [Vault 44] encounter facedown to the left of this card

title: Wacky Wasteland
text: After the day's events, you are, quite frankly, a little confused. The wasteland is a place of adventure, danger, and, apparently, absurdity.

options.optionText:
Go this-a-way.

[Quest] Any [Wasteland]

Go that-a-way.

[Quest] Any [Wasteland]

It's more about the journey than the destination. Head in a random direction.

[Quest] Any [Wasteland] • Have [L]

text: A group of men in power armor are gathered around one another in a heated discussion. They introduce themselves as King Arthur and his knights, and they claim to be searching for the Holy Hand Grenade. Clearly, these men are mad.

options.optionText: Point them to the desert. Better they die in the wastes and trouble you no longer • [C] 4

result.result: Succeed:The knights thank you for your help and give you a handsome reward.
Fail: Indignant, the knights return to their discussion.

options.optionText: Gently suggest that they seek further information from an inn or a bar in town, and secretly vow to stay far, far away • [I] 4

result.result: Succeed: Acquiescing to your unreliable logic, they set off toward the nearest settlement. You hope that someone there will be able to help them.

text: You approach a strange stone arch in the desert. You don't know what it is, but you feel a heavy weight pulling down on you as you approach.

options.optionText: Step through the arch
options.result: You find yourself transported to a dark room surrounded by computers, the stone arch still providing an exit behind you. A majectic blaster rifle sits in a nearby case, glowing slightly. You take it, but in doing so you accidentally short some of the computers. A warning pops up on one of the screens. '100 days left of water.' The date on the log reads a few months prior. You see norhing else around you and step back from the stone arch.

options.optionText: Destroy it, whatever it is
options.result: You tip the stone onto its side and the unnatural heaviness in the area dissipates. You can't help but feel like you've done something good.
